Decorators¶

Decorators allow certain functions within an API endpoint to be described for third-party developers.

bambu_api.decorators.argument(name, type='str', description='', **kwargs)¶
Parameters:
  • name – The name of the argument
  • type – The type of the argument (default is str)
  • description – The type of the argument (default is an empty string)
  • required – This argument is required by the endpoint (default is True)

This decorator defines an API argument in order that in can be automatically added to the HTML documentation for the endpoint.

When the keyword argument required is set to True (by default), that argument’s value must be specified in the path of the endpoint call. This is usually reserved for referring to an object by ID, as in the example /polls/question/1.json, with 1 being the required parameter.

When the keyword argument required is set to False, that argument’s value must be specified as part of the query string.

bambu_api.decorators.returns(name_or_dict, type='str', description='', **kwargs)¶
Parameters:
  • name_or_dict – The name of a key or a full dictionary mapping keys to types and descriptions
  • type – The type of value associated with the key (when name_or_dict is a string)
  • description – the description of the value (when name_or_dict is a string)

This decorator allows you to specify what data is returned by a function within an API endpoint. It’s used to build the HTML documentation for each endpoint. The returned data for an endpoint is assumed to be a dictionary (or list of dictionaries), so you use the @returns decorator to specify what each key in that dictionary provides.
